alert.note: Alert for Buchanan (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 8:17AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Buchanan, northwestern McDowell, southeastern Mingo, southeastern Logan and western Wyoming Counties through 845 AM EST... At 817 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gilbert Creek, or 20 miles southeast of Williamson, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Welch, Pineville, Oceana, Hanover, R.d. Bailey Lake, Gilbert Creek, Hinch, Gilbert, Davy, Iaeger, Kimball, Clear Fork, Panther, Cyclone, Coal Mountain, Hampden, Kopperston, Wolf Pen, Meador and Baileysville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause elevated levels on small creeks and streams, and ponding of water on country roads and farmland along the banks of creeks and streams.
